turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Ew! Oh, Buff! Relax!

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Why don't you fucking relax? He's having verbal intercourse, Sooze.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Buff is funny, okay? She likes Buff, so why don't you whip shut the feminist hole.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Hey, why don't you swallow your cock and choke on it? Oh, I forgot, it's not big enough.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: It was the nicest thin I've done in a long time.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Oh that's nice for you.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Forget about New York, Jeff. I don't want to talk about New York anymore.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: There was this other place where they served live monkey brains. Sweat to God. You walk in, they bring the little monkey out, shave his head, crack it open, and you eat it's brains while it's still alive. I didn't go in, though, 'cause I didn't have any money and my mom has a saying: "Don't write any checks you can't cash".

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Could you give me a ride?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Oh yes! Yeah, man, give her the ride, the ol' Pony ride back to the hotel.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Tim, go throw up somewhere.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: I'm going out later.

turns.speaker: SOOZE'S MOM
turns.text: No car.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: The fuck not?

turns.speaker: SOOZE'S MOM
turns.text: You know the fuck not.

turns.speaker: SOOZE
turns.text: Fuck.

turns.speaker: SOOZE'S MOM
turns.text: Don't swear it's impolite.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Wait!  Did you say you are pregnant or you were pregnant... You had it, threw it out and you're gonna go back and dance all night!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Shut up, Cleo.  Di, how much do you need for an abortion?

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: You piece-a-shit bug zapper!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: I can't believe your grandparents never come down here.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: You have three heart attacks and a half dozen strokes and tell me how much you wanna run up and down the stairs.  Shit - I forgot to pick up the cigarettes.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Who are you - the goddamn Bionic Woman?!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: I just pulled and it - it came off.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: This is great - GREAT!  Now we have to enter the front door!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Look, it's really not my fault.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Hey!  Rule number one - never take off the mask!  Y'hear me!  No matter what happens, NEVER TAKE OFF THE MASK!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Sorry, Kansas...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: NO-GAH-BUH- NO!  Rule number two - NO NAMES!  NO GODDAMN NAMES, you retard!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Oh for Chrissakes...  "White trash Betty."  I didn't realize the rules went into effect before we entered Safeway.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Well, use your head, "Stalker Betty."

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: You just became a statistic!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: I'm in, too.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Cleo!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Kansas is right.  We're like sisters -- we're closer than sisters.  And you don't turn your back on family.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: And you know real cops aren't half as smart as Keanu.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Forget it.  I've got a scholarship to Harvard hanging over my head.  I won't risk it.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Conan went to Harvard.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Ahh!  Baby's got two heads!!!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: It's twins!!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Can you guys believe this?  We're like celebrities!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Better enjoy it now.  'Cause tomorrow some little kid falls down a well and we're nothing but a distant memory.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Another sex dream?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Wayne Gretzky.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Di, are you okay?  We can skip the girl party this week.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Everything's fine.  I'm just having a little trouble keeping my frown upside down.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: ...He slices off the guy's ear, and I mean you see everything - the bloody pink hole where the --

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Cleo, I've already thrown up twice today - could you please get to any relevant part of the movie?

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Well...uh...they, y'know, uh... They had nicknames.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Di, we're sorry.  We...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: It's off... I can't take the fighting, the back-stabbing, the open hostility. We're not acting like cheerleaders, we're acting like a bunch of sorority girls!

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Is Jack upset that he can't be here?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hee-hee-haaaa-weee worked it out.  Heee hee-haaa....

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Use the bathroom, because the Port-a Potties on the field are gross.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: My fault - What do we do that enables us to be as great as we are?

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: I personally think of how Conan started as a writer, then became a...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Di?  I just called to say that Conan talked about us again last night.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Thanks, Cleo.  See you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CLEO
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Diane?  Diane!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Huh-ha-wha?  Ahh!  I'm under the ice!  I'm uh -- oh...man...  That was a weird one.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh my G-d, you've been robbed!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: No...I've been pregnant.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Look, you're fat, Diane.  You're fat, fat, fat!  Because you eat, eat, eat!  What?!  She keeps asking because she wants some honesty.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: No I don't... I keep asking because I feel fat.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh G-d, I'm sorry... You're not really fat!  I was just saying that because, uh, I thought that's what you wanted me to say.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Positive.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: "Positive" you're sure I'm not fat or "positive" I'm...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh my G-d, I read about this!  It's called a "pregnancy insanity."  Quick, she needs a sitz bath --

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Look, I might be moody.  I might be gassy.  But I am perfectly sane.  Think about it.  In school, they tell us, "Dreams can come true."  Right?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: C'mon, Luce, people do it in the movies all the time.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: And they get caught!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: That's right.  So all we have to do is watch a bunch of movies and learn from their mistakes.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: If you don't - can you still afford to go to Harvard?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: ... I don't know.  Probably not.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: So then this isn't crazy.  It's a sure bet.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: But, we have to make a smart plan!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Of course - of course!  Hands in...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Okay, even with all our savings, it's still only six hundred fifty-four.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hee-hee-hee, haaaaa-that's it?  Hee-hee hee...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: -- We practice!  Sorry, Cleo.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: That's right.  Practice makes perfect. I'm practicing to have a baby right now. If we do a practice job, we'll not only get the experience, but also the extra money we need for guns!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Di, it's Luce.  Kansas just called and said she's going to "fuck me up!"  Then I heard coughing, a thud and Kansas had to go.  I think her Grandma had another heart attack.  Anyway, why does she want to "fuck me up?"

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: She thinks you went to the police.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: WHAT?!  That's insane!!!  Why would I go to the police?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I've got to get that.  Relax.  I'll see you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hi, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Excuse me, Vendela, have you seen Diane? We're supposed to go to the homecoming dance tonight.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: ... so when your dad said, "I never want to see your "f-'in' faces again!" do you think he meant forever or just until your mom wakes up?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know... And what the hell was that sound she made right before she hit the coffee table.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Well, if I had to guess...  I'd say that was the sound of a mother saying good-bye to her little boy and hello to a young man who's going to be a daddy of his own...  Jack, do you know what I see here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Spit from your dad?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I see a flower.  And y'know, even the most beautiful flowers still grow from dirt.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: So, while we're knee deep in right now - and things seem pretty "stinky" - in the long run, we're going to grow strong from this.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Y'think?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I sure do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Diane, I've loved you ever since I first saw you -- right before you kicked me in the head.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Oh, Jack...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Jack, sweetie, I'm only eating for two.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But Di, all this food reminds me of how much I want to teach our baby.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like Cocoa Puffs.  Good.  Captain Crunch.  Bad.  Shreds the roof of your mouth.  I mean you hear, "Tricks are for kids!"  And you think, "I'm a kid, I guess they're for me."  But your baby brain's got no idea that Fruit Loops are, like, a million times better.  I'm going to save our kid all that pain.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If you could be Count Chocula, Frankenberry or Trix the Rabbit, who'd you be?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Trix...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Me too!  Will it ever end?!  I love this lady!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Jack, I think I should get a job.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But we agreed your job is running the baby machine...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I know, but that was before.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ah!  I almost forgot gas for the baby machine.  I'll grab your Snickers and get a place in line.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I never knew you dreamed of working in a grocery store bank branch.  Baby, we are living the great American Dream!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Mmm-hmmm...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: If you reach for the stars, you're bound to get -- mm-Jack, pull over.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Huh?  Oh Jesus...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Uh, Jack - look, I can explain...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Diane, there's no excuse for not taking your pre-natal vitamins.  Now, if you guys were really friends, you'd remind her to take these.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ...so although their dad said, "Don't get out of the car until I get back with help," they knew the sheriff's voice as he yelled.  "Run to my voice - and don't look back."  The twins did as he said, but at the last second they turned around and saw the escaped mental patient, bouncing their father's head on the top of the car!  Ah!  They jumped, Diane!  They jumped!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: That was gas, Sweetie.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oh... What are you working on?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Jus some girlie things for the squad.

turns.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: What?!  But all our paperwork's there. My school records, Jack's football records...

turns.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
turns.text: Let me explain something...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: No.  Wait!  Did I say Promise!  Cross-my heart and hope-to-die, stick-a-needle-in my-eye we'll never miss a payment?!

turns.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
turns.text: Uh, yes.  Yes you did.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: ...do not accept charity.  We are two young, able-bodied Americans.  We do not want a handout.  We want a hand-up. Give us food and we will be hungry tomorrow.  Give us corn - the kind you plant, not eat - and we'll grow our own food and... and, uh, then cut it, and - uh, y'know eat it!  Now, if you're interested in giving us a home loan, I will sit back down.  If not, have a nice day, Ma'am.

turns.speaker: LOAN OFFICER
turns.text: Sorry.  My hands are tied.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Anyway, last time I checked, you still had to have sex to have an orgasm.  And I know she ain't seen the lord on all fours - so I'm just saying.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Well, I want to know what happened --

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Nope.  Sounds more like the first.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I'll just ask the question myself... "Is Jack Bartlett interested in me?"

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Madonna.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: We're here for you, Diane.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Hat-trick?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: He is the Great One...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: "No" you're not sure or "No" I'm not fat?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Uh, "no"... You're not fat.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: You sure I'm not fat?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Listen, Kansas, I know you dream of springing your mom some day...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Stop, you're gonna make me cry.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: And if the O.J. trial taught us anything, it taught us that in America, you can cut off someone's head and still be found innocent if you have enough money.  Your mom only shot a guy...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Lucy, do you know for sure you're going to get that scholarship?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Kansas!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: I'm sorry, Diane, but I'm not gonna watch my dreams fade away 'cause the Virgin Mary here thinks she's gonna get ideas from kiddie movies --

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: It's all my fault.  I'm sorry I ever started this...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Di, it's not your fault.  We all wanted to do this - for you... for ourselves.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Oh, thank G-d!  I'm not just super fat!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Oh - okay, we ain't done with this... Those babies are gonna get a good start in life - with a real crib - one that costs a shit-load!  We're gonna learn how to rob a bank from the only people who really know how to do it - criminals!  I'm gonna visit my mom!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: NO!  Wait...um...  We're the A-squad from Lincoln High? So, uh...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: We were told you could "fix us up."

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Hey.  Eyes on your own belly!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hee-hee-h-wait a minute.  Hold on, now. What do we do before a big game?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Oh no...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: He Ikea'd us.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: It was Lucy!  Lucy went to the cops!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Remember, Kansas, every time you point a finger you've got three more pointing back at you.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: She's been the weak tit on this mama cat since the beginning.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: That you?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Yeah, hold on.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Just call me later.  I gotta get some smokes for Grandma.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Don't use big bills!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: For a pack of cigs?  I use her food stamps.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DIM SUM CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh thank Buddha it's you, Kim-Lo, I'm being held against my will, my civil rights have been violated and it took four days to make this one phone call...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: DIM SUM CHARLIE
turns.text: Kim-Lo?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: No.  This is Diane.  I think you have the wrong number.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Ooops, that's me -- gotta run!

turns.speaker: DIM SUM CHARLIE
turns.text: Wrong number  Nooooooo!

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I guess there's an exception to every rule.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Well, we'll each probably want one - so let's make it five.  Five should do it.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Okay.  How much ammo you reckon you'll need?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Ammo?

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Bullets.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Bullets?  No bullets!  Oh my gosh, these are just to scare people. Kinda like round-off, back handspring, whip back, double full.  You never really use it - you just want the opposing squad to know you've got it.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Right.  That'll be fifteen hundred - cash.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hey, hey, hey.  C'mon you guys.  Obviously that's a little more than our budget will allow.  Basically, we're looking for something around two-hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Oh, why didn't you say.  For two-hundred I got a nice rubber band and a real sharp nail in back... I'll gift wrap it for you.  The deal is fifteen hundred. Cash.  Take it or leave it.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: My daughter's always dreamed of bein' a cheerleader.  Put her on your squad and I'll give you the guns.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Fern!  C'mere!  She's siphoning tanks - takes a sec to cap off the cyanide hose.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: ... Ja-ck B-ar-t-le-tt... Is Jack Bartlett interested in me?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I-I'm sorry - can someone else please run the Ouija board?  It's creepy, it's wrong and it goes against the teachings of my Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I-I didn't mean to say "whore," Diane. I just hear it so much at church - it kinda came flying out of my head.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I know, Hannah.  Look, I'm not going to get an abortion.  I mean, I always planned to get married and have kids - I'm just going a little out of order. Kinda reminds me of another young lady who found herself "with child," unmarried, on a long road, with no place to sleep.  'Course, that was a long-long time ago.  But no matter what, she held her head high and said... "Pappa don't preach, I'm in trouble deep.  Pappa don't preach, 'cause I'm keepin' my baby.  Hey.  I'm gonna keep my baby." The great one...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: You want us to help you pick up?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Don't Martha-fucking-Stewart me!  If you don't like it - you try being a pregnant teen!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: And Hannah, you could give your share to your church - or maybe buy one of those hungry little kids Sally Struthers advertises.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Or, I could get my own horse...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Or that!  Look, you guys, I just want to provide a future for my baby.  I know my bank branch like the back of my puffy little hand.  I could open that safe in my sleep!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Look, maybe I can watch a PG movie... I'll just say I'm counting dirty words for Sunday School.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: That's okay, Hannah.  It was silly to think we could learn to rob a bank from watching movies.  Sex - you can learn from movies.  But robberies?  There's no way.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: We're dead!  They showed this prison movie to my youth group on Sunday.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hannah, we've...

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: It wasn't like the prison we saw - all these women had to shave their heads because they got lice from the filthy lives they'd lived!  Oh G-d, I'm gonna be someone's bald bitch!

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Ooops, hold on a sec.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: ...my Sunday School teacher says that in prison, women shove broom sticks up your...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hold on...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Screw Lucy!

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: Kansas?

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: Is that you down there?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Shit!  Yeah, Grandma.  Me and the squad.

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: Are you girls talking about boys? Practicing kissing your hands?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Oh yeah, you caught us...

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: Oh well, then I'll put some cookies at the top of the stairs for you gals.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Thanks!  That'd be great.

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: You got that big retarded girl down there?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Uh...Yeah, Grandma.  She doesn't mean that.  Kinda lost the old filter with her last stroke.

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: Then I'll throw a few more treats on the plate.  Where's my smokes?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: I'll get them before "Touched by an Angel," don't worry.

turns.speaker: GRANDMOTHER
turns.text: You damn well better...

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Really...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Yeah.  "Itchy" sent us.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: She did, did she?  How is the old girl?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Definitely old.

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: That's Itchy, alright.  How many y'need?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh please, we've all got bright futures ahead of us - we're not going to tell anyone.  Promise!

turns.speaker: HANK
turns.text: Maybe we can make a deal.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Hannah, in order to get real answers from the netherworld, you've gotta have a Christian virgin run the board.  Your kind is pure of heart - the devil won't dick with you.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Well technically, I don't think I'm a virgin anymore.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Yeah.  This summer at church camp?  I'm pretty sure I had, y'know, an orgasm.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Hold up, hold up.  Any sentence that starts with "at church camp" ain't leading to the big "O."

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Oh my G-d!  I'm not first!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: But you're not married.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: ...so, while it's a laugh riot for the whole family, and Tim Conway is just about as funny as they come, especially when he goes...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Wait a minute.  You watched the Apple fucking-Dumpling Gang?!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: I'm only allowed "G" movies.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Am I the only one who cares about this? At least I watched "Dog Day Afternoon!"

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: You sure you wanna go there?

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Uh...maybe?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: 'Cause I will Jerry Springer you faster than you can say "Fat-assed lesbian!"

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Don't make me Jerry Lewis you guys for the rest.

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Hey, I even took my parents' foster kid money.  Phillipe's gonna have to gather rice without pants this month.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: All of you!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: Bank branch!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Bank branch!

turns.speaker: HANNAH
turns.text: All of you!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Grandma and Grandpa sent you pictures of a neighbor girl.  They didn't want you to break out and come kidnap me.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Thank G-d.  I was starting to think I'd killed the wrong man.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: You shouldn't smoke so many of those.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: I know, but it keeps down the size of my can.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: They could kill you.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: So could half the women in here.  And I'd rather go out with a nice can... So watcha here for?  To say how much you hate me or how much your grandparents hate me...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: I don't hate you.  I need your help.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: My what?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Your help.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Now how the hell can I help you?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Okay, you can't tell anybody.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Gee, I'll sit out this afternoon's coffee talk.  Whaddya want?

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: My best friend got pregnant.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Before you?  Whoo-hoo!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: I know - that's what I said too. Anyway, we want to help her get some money for the baby by robbing a bank.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Well, shit-fire, Kansas, that's the sweetest goddamn thing ever...

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: I know, but we can't quite figure out how to, y'know, do it.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: So you need my help?  Oh my G-d, this is like asking me for help with your homework.  Hey, Mink, c'mere!

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Kansas, I want you to meet someone special.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Oh, Jesus Christ, Mom!  Like my life ain't a great big pile-of-shit 'cause you're in here?  Now I have to add, "P.S. My mom's a dyke" too?

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: What?!  Hush up, you mouthy little shit!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Hey, don't "mouthy shit" me - I'm outta here.

turns.speaker: MRS. HILL
turns.text: Wait, Petunia.  Mommy's a little amped up - didn't get her yard time this morning.  Mink ain't my bitch.  She's a specialist... in banks.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Diane, it says here you're going to have mood swings, uncontrollable gas.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: More proof God's a guy...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: ...and sex dreams where you actually have an orgasm!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: Virgin Mary musta snuck that one in.

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: I mean it.  I'm in.  This is the closest thing to a goddamn family that I've ever had.  If one of us needs something, we all do.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Stop it!  This is crazy!

turns.speaker: KANSAS
turns.text: What the hell do you want?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I want to help.  I'm part of this squad...

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: I hate to think where that puts me.  I could be her father.

turns.speaker: 1ST ASSISTANT
turns.text: I'm terribly sorry, Mr. de Mille.

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: It must be about that appalling script of hers.  What can I say to her? What can I say?

turns.speaker: 1ST ASSISTANT
turns.text: I can tell her you're all tied up in the projection room.  I can give her the brush ...

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: Listen, thirty million fans have given her the brush. Isn't that enough?

turns.speaker: 1ST ASSISTANT
turns.text: I didn't mean to --

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: Of course you didn't.  You didn't know Norma Desmond as a plucky little girl of seventeen, with more courage and wit and heart than ever came together in one youngster.

turns.speaker: 1ST ASSISTANT
turns.text: I hear she was a terror to work with.

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: She got to be.  A dozen press agents working overtime can do terrible things to the human spirit.  Hold everything.

turns.speaker: 1ST ASSISTANT
turns.text: We're ready with the shot, Mr. deMille.

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: You'll pardon me, Norma? Why don't you just sit and watch?  O.K.  Here we go.

turns.speaker: 1ST ASSISTANT
turns.text: Roll 'em.

turns.speaker: DEMILLE
turns.text: Action! The scene starts.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Well, what do you know ! Joe Gillis !

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: Hi, Artie.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Where have you been keeping that gorgeous face of yours?

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: In a deep freeze.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: I almost reported you to the Bureau of Missing Persons.  Fans, you all know Joe Gillis, the well-known screen writer, opium smuggler and Black Dahlia suspect.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Give me your coat.

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: Let it ride for a while.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: You're going to stay, aren't you?

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: That was the general idea.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Judas E. Priest, who did you borrow that from? Adolphe Menjou?

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: Close, but no cigar.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Say, you're not really smuggling opium these days,  are you?

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: Where's the bar?

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: Good party.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: The greatest.  They call me the Elsa Maxwell of the assistant directors.  Hey, easy on the punch bowl.  Budget only calls for three drinks per extra. Fake the rest.

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: Listen, Artie, can I stick around here for a while?

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: Sure, this'll go on all night.

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: I mean, could you put me up for a couple of weeks?

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: It just so happens we have a vacancy on the couch.

turns.speaker: GILLIS
turns.text: I'll take it.

turns.speaker: ARTIE
turns.text: I'll have the bell-hop take care of your luggage.
